result.execSummary:
The defendant Melvin Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felony Murder-Armed Robbery, an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.03.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $3,348.32.  Joint and several with Jonathan Sellers. To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) Wis. stats and during Extended Supervision and is payble to the Crime Victims Compensation Fund through the Clerk of Courts office. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Pay DNA surcharge and all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and asessments.  To be collected by DOC from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to Extended Supervision but remain a condition of Extended Supervision.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other senence.
*6/8/2015 credit amended to 528 days.

superMiscConds.notes: Seek and maintain full time employment.  Obtain high school diploma or GED.  Vocational/educational training.

No drugs.  No contact with drug community.
No contact with victim's family and coator Jonathan Sellers.
Alcohol and drug assessment. Comply with recommended treatment. Random urine screens.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample, pay mandatory surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.

per remittitur dated January 9, 2018, Appeal No. 2016AP001820 CRNM, IT IS ORDERED AND ADJUDGED by this court in a decision filed on August 23, 2017, that:  IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction and order are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt is relieved from further representing Melvin Jones in this appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).

records.addlTxt: per order dated September 26, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1820CRNM, the motion is granted. Defendant-appellant-petitioner shall have until October 26, 2017, to serve and file a supplemental petition in support of the no-merit petition for review. If the supplemental petition is not filed by that time, this matter will be disposed of based solely on the no-merit petition filed by Attorney Mark Schoenfeldt.
per order dated September 19, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1820CRNM, the motion for reconsideration is denied.
from Diane F. (Wisconsin Supreme Court) to Defendant (Appeal No. 2016AP1820CRNM)

per order dated August 23, 2017, Appeal No. 2016AP1820-CRNM, IT IS ORDERED that the judgment of conviction and order are summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that Attorney Mark A. Schoenfeldt is relieved from further representing Melvin Jones in this appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Melvin Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Defendant Melvin Jones in custody.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Exhibit 1 marked for identification.  Video of defendant's statement played for the court.
Sentencing proceeded.  Presentence Investigation reviewed.  Additions and corrections made.  Statements by state, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by Lisa F., Barbara B., Jerome S.and Michael W.
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 35 YEARS  consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 592 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 25 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 10 YEARS.  Conditions of extended supervision:
*Alcohol and drug assessment and comply with recommended treatment.
*Random urine screens.
*No drugs.
*No contact with drug community.
*No contact with victim's family and co-actor Jonathan Sellers
*Seek and maintain fulltime employment
*Obtain high school diploma or GED
*Cognitive Behavior Therapy
*Restitution joint and several with Jonathan Sellers in the sum of $3,348.32
*Vocational/educational training
*Pay all costs and surcharges

Court ordered defendant to provide DNA sample and imposed mandatory surcharges.
The Court ordered the defendant to pay DNA surcharge AND all other applicable costs and any other surcharges and assessments to be collected by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds and to convert to civil judgment upon release to extended supervision but remain a condition of extended supervision.  

Restitution is to be collected by the DOC from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b), Wis. Stats. and during extended supervision and is payable to the Crime Victims Compensation Fund through the Clerk of Courts office.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

Exhibit List received and filed.
Court informs defendant he is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program or Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may not possess any firearms and body armor and that he may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into to the custody of the MIlwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Filed,
- Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;

STATE'S REQUESTED JURY INSTRUCTIONS, FILED
STATE'S WITNESS LIST, FILED

Defendant Melvin Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Defendant Melvin Jones in custody produced.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.     Defense counsel has received  offer.  Defendant has waived his right to hearing in Juvenile jurisdiction.  

AS TO AMENDED COUNTS 1 & 2, NOW COUNT 1:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was ordered.  Jury trial previously scheduled is vacated.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 10.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Melvin Jones in court with attorney Jeffrey William Jensen.  Defendant Melvin Jones in custody produced.  Grant Ian Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

 Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading,   On motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to:

Counts 1 & 2 are amended to Count 1, Felony Murder, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 940.03 , a Class U Felony.
Crime Victim Impact Statements from family and friends and Restitution Information.  Received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk:  AA.

Joint motion to adjourn granted by the court.  Case adjourned for final pretrial in Branch 10.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 13, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Case is adjourned for final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 10.
Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen in court, defendant Melvin Jones not in court, in custody.  Antoni J. Apollo appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Grant Huebner.
Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for December 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jeffrey William Jensen in court, defendant Melvin Jones not in court, in custody.  Grant Huebner appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case adjourned for arraingment in Branch 10.  Arraignment scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.

Attorney Jeffrey Jensen appears for the defendant. Defendant, Melvin Jones, appears in custody. Grant Huebner appears by Sara Lewis for the State of Wisconsin.
Court grants request by Attorney Jensen to take judicial notice of Dr. Stephen Emiley's psychological evaluation, under the delinquency case, and Dr. Deborah Collins' competency evaluation and testimony taken at the competency hearing. 
Sworn and testified for the defense: Dr. Courtney Enderis
Exhibit #1 marked and received as evidence for the defense.
Defense rests.
Sworn and testified for the state: Dr. Stephen Emiley
Court breaks for lunch at Noon. Case recalled at 1:35 p.m., same appearances. 
Sworn and testified for the state: Dr. Deborah Collins
Exhibits #2, #3, #4 marked and received as evidence for the state.
State rests. Testimony closed. Oral arguments heard. Court makes findings of facts and conclusions of law. Court denies motion to reverse waive Melvin Jones to Juvenile Court. Case adjourned to 11-6-14 at 8:30 a.m. in Br. 10 for status conference. Court remands Melvin Jones to the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Office on continuing $100,000.00 cash bail, to be housed at CJF. 
Addendum to Delinquency Order for Temporary Physical Custody, signed and filed.
Exhibit List, signed and filed.

filed by Dr. Deborah Collins for 10/31/14 ct. hrg. bp.

Attorney Jeffrey Jensen appears for the defendant. Defendant, Melvin Jones, appears in custody. Grant Huebner appears for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Huebner requests to reschedule the hearing set for 9/26/14 at 9:00, and Attorney Jensen objects, for reasons stated. Court grants request. The next court date is 10/31/14 at 8:30 in Br. 16 for reverse waiver hearing. Court orders the evaluation report by Dr. Collins must be provided to Attorney Jensen and the Court by 10/15/14. The placement order regarding the defendant continues. Addendum to Delinquency Order for Temporary Physical Custody, signed and filed.
rmr
The State and Defense were both unable to make todays hearing. It has been rescheduled to 9/18/14 11am Br 16, Status.

Attorney Jeffrey Jensen appears for the defendant. Defendant, Melvin Jones, appears in custody. Grant Huebner appears for the State of Wisconsin. Dr. Deborah Collins did not receive a subpoena for this hearing, but will be able to appear to testify today. Attorney Jensen acknowledges receipt of Dr. Collins' report. Melvin Jones claims to be incompetent. Case passed to allow Dr. Collins to appear. Case recalled; appearances are the same, with the addition of Dr. Deborah Collins.
Sworn and testified for the State: Dr. Deborah Collins
Exhibit 1 marked and received as evidence for the State.
Oral arguments heard. Court finds that Melvin Jones is competent to proceed. Case adjourned to 8/29/14 at 3:00 for status hearing re: Dr. Endris' report and 9/26/14 at 9:00 for evidentiary hearing re: reverse waiver in Br. 16.  Attorney Jensen to provide Dr. Endris' report to the State no later than 8/25/14. Court denies request for placement at LHS. Addendum to Delinquency Order for Temporary Physical Custody, signed and filed.
